alert.note: Alert for Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Watch issued December 10 at 11:07AM PST until December 11 at 6:00PM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WATCH FOR THE FISH AND LAKE BURN SCARS REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding and debris flows caused by excessive rainfall is possible in and near the recent burn areas, including the Fish and Lake burn scars. * WHERE...The recent burn area in Los Angeles County, including the Fish and Lake burn scars. * WHEN...From late tonight through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Heavy rainfall over the Fish and Lake burn scars is expected up to and during the period of the watch. Residents near these burn scars should prepare for potential flooding impacts. Be sure to stay up to date with information from local authorities. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - National Weather Service Meteorologists are forecasting potential heavy rainfall over the recent Los Angeles County burn scars, which may lead to flash flooding and debris flows. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Southern California residents, in or below the recently burned areas are urged to take the steps necessary to protect their property. Persons in the watch area should remain alert and follow directions of emergency preparedness officials.

area.areaDesc: Antelope Valley; Los Angeles County Mountains; Los Angeles County San Gabriel Valley
